clinical_study.brief_title: Hypnosis Intervention for the Management of Pain Perception During Joint Lavage
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Efficacy of Hypnosis Intervention During Lavage Procedure for Knee Osteoarthrosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether hypnosis intervention added to usual care is more effective than usual care alone to control pain during lavage procedure in patients with knee osteoarthrosis

detailed_description.textblock: Joint lavage can be used in acute knee osteoarthritis, and can be repeated when it is effective. This procedure can generate pain and anxiety which are prevented by systematic prescription of analgesics and anxiolytics. To assess the benefit of hypnosis intervention, the investigators designed a monocentric prospective controlled randomised, single-blind study. Patients with acute and painful knee osteoarthritis, having an indication of lavage according to the rheumatologist, will be randomized to standard care, versus standard care and hypnosis. The hypothesis is that hypnosis intervention will decrease the level of pain during lavage, and the analgesics consumption during the week following the lavage. The sample size will be 100, 50 patients per group. Inclusion is scheduled for 18 months, and duration of the study will be 2 years. The main efficacy criterion is the pain score (assessed using VAS) difference between the 2groups; no interim analysis will be performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain assessed by Visual Analog Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: One Day, at end of lavage procedure
primary_outcome.description: VAS range 0-10, 10 for most severe pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Anxiety assessed by Visual Analog Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, at end of lavage procedure
secondary_outcome.description: VAS range 0-10, 10 for most severe anxiety

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, at end of lavage procedure
secondary_outcome.description: 4 points : Perfectly tolerable / tolerable / with difficulty / untolerable

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of knee osteoarthritis
- indication for a lavage
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous knee lavage
- psychiatric diseases (current or past)
- current use of psychotropic drugs
- patient refusal
